segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 54
segments.en: Linked Discourses 54

segments.pli: 1. Ekadhammavagga
segments.en: 1. One Thing

segments.pli: 10. Kimilasutta
segments.en: 10. With Kimbila

segments.pli: Evaṃ me sutaṃ—
segments.en: So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kimilāyaṃ viharati veḷuvane.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kimbilā in the Freshwater Mangrove Wood.

segments.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ kimilaṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Kimbila,

segments.pli: “kathaṃ bhāvito nu kho, kimila, ānāpānassatisamādhi kathaṃ bahulīkato mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso”ti?
segments.en: “Kimbila, how is immersion due to mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated so that it is very fruitful and beneficial?”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā kimilo tuṇhī ahosi.
segments.en: When he said this, Kimbila kept silent.

segments.pli: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā … pe …
segments.en: For a second time …

segments.pli: tatiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ kimilaṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: And for a third time, the Buddha said to him,

segments.pli: “kathaṃ bhāvito nu kho, kimila, ānāpānassatisamādhi kathaṃ bahulīkato mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso”ti?
segments.en: “How is immersion due to mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated so that it is very fruitful and beneficial?”

segments.pli: Tatiyampi kho āyasmā kimilo tuṇhī ahosi.
segments.en: And a second time and a third time Kimbila kept silent.

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, Venerable Ānanda said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “etassa, bhagavā, kālo; etassa, sugata, kālo.
segments.en: “Now is the time, Blessed One! Now is the time, Holy One!

segments.pli: Yaṃ bhagavā ānāpānassatisamādhiṃ bhāseyya, bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
segments.en: Let the Buddha speak on immersion due to mindfulness of breathing. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”

segments.pli: “Tenahānanda, suṇāhi, sādhukaṃ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
segments.en: “Well then, Ānanda, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

segments.pli: Bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “kathaṃ bhāvito ca, ānanda, ānāpānassatisamādhi kathaṃ bahulīkato mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso?
segments.en: “Ānanda, how is immersion due to mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated so that it is very fruitful and beneficial?

segments.pli: Idhānanda, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, sits down cross-legged, with their body straight, and establishes mindfulness right there.

segments.pli: So satova assasati, satova passasati … pe …
segments.en: Just mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out. …

segments.pli: ‘paṭinissaggānupassī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, ‘paṭinissaggānupassī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati.
segments.en: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ bhāvito kho, ānanda, ānāpānassatisamādhi evaṃ bahulīkato mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṃso.
segments.en: That’s how immersion due to mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated, is very fruitful and beneficial.

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, ānanda, bhikkhu dīghaṃ vā assasanto ‘dīghaṃ assasāmī’ti pajānāti, dīghaṃ vā passasanto ‘dīghaṃ passasāmī’ti pajānāti;
segments.en: When a mendicant is breathing in heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing in heavily.’ When breathing out heavily they know: ‘I’m breathing out heavily.’

segments.pli: rassaṃ vā assasanto ‘rassaṃ assasāmī’ti pajānāti, rassaṃ vā passasanto ‘rassaṃ passasāmī’ti pajānāti;
segments.en: When breathing in lightly they know: ‘I’m breathing in lightly.’ When breathing out lightly they know: ‘I’m breathing out lightly.’

segments.pli: ‘sabbakāyappaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, ‘sabbakāyappaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati;
segments.en: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in experiencing the whole body.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out experiencing the whole body.’

segments.pli: ‘passambhayaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, ‘passambhayaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ passasissāmī’ti sikkhati—
segments.en: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in stilling the physical process.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out stilling the physical process.’

segments.pli: kāye kāyānupassī, ānanda, bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: At such a time a mendicant is meditating by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Kāyaññatarāhaṃ, ānanda, etaṃ vadāmi yadidaṃ—assāsapassāsaṃ.
segments.en: Because the breath is a certain aspect of the body, I say.

segments.pli: Tasmātihānanda, kāye kāyānupassī bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: Therefore, at such a time a mendicant is meditating by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, ānanda, bhikkhu ‘pītippaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, ‘pītippaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati;
segments.en: There’s a time when a mendicant practices like this: ‘I’ll breathe in experiencing rapture.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out experiencing rapture.’

segments.pli: ‘sukhappaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, ‘sukhappaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati;
segments.en: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in experiencing bliss.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out experiencing bliss.’

segments.pli: ‘cittasaṅkhārappaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, ‘cittasaṅkhārappaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati;
segments.en: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in experiencing the mental processes.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out experiencing the mental processes.’

segments.pli: ‘passambhayaṃ cittasaṅkhāraṃ passasissāmī’ti sikkhati—
segments.en: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in stilling the mental processes.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out stilling the mental processes.’

segments.pli: vedanāsu vedanānupassī, ānanda, bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: At such a time a mendicant is meditating by observing an aspect of feelings—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Vedanāññatarāhaṃ, ānanda, etaṃ vadāmi, yadidaṃ—assāsapassāsānaṃ sādhukaṃ manasikāraṃ.
segments.en: Because close focus on the breath is a certain aspect of feelings, I say.

segments.pli: Tasmātihānanda, vedanāsu vedanānupassī bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ. (2)
segments.en: Therefore, at such a time a mendicant is meditating by observing an aspect of feelings—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, ānanda, bhikkhu ‘cittappaṭisaṃvedī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, ‘cittappaṭisaṃvedī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati;
segments.en: There’s a time when a mendicant practices like this: ‘I’ll breathe in experiencing the mind.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out experiencing the mind.’

segments.pli: abhippamodayaṃ cittaṃ … pe …
segments.en: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in gladdening the mind.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out gladdening the mind.’

segments.pli: samādahaṃ cittaṃ …
segments.en: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in immersing the mind in samādhi.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out immersing the mind in samādhi.’

segments.pli: ‘vimocayaṃ cittaṃ assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, ‘vimocayaṃ cittaṃ passasissāmī’ti sikkhati—
segments.en: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in freeing the mind.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out freeing the mind.’

segments.pli: citte cittānupassī, ānanda, bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: At such a time a mendicant is meditating by observing an aspect of the mind—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Nāhaṃ, ānanda, muṭṭhassatissa asampajānassa ānāpānassatisamādhibhāvanaṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: Because there is no development of immersion due to mindfulness of breathing for someone who is unmindful and lacks awareness, I say.

segments.pli: Tasmātihānanda, citte cittānupassī bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ. (3)
segments.en: Therefore, at such a time a mendicant is meditating by observing an aspect of the mind—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, ānanda, bhikkhu ‘aniccānupassī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati … pe …
segments.en: There’s a time when a mendicant practices like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing impermanence.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing impermanence.’

segments.pli: virāgānupassī …
segments.en: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing fading away.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing fading away.’

segments.pli: nirodhānupassī …
segments.en: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing cessation.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing cessation.’

segments.pli: ‘paṭinissaggānupassī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati, ‘paṭinissaggānupassī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati—
segments.en: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’

segments.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī, ānanda, bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: At such a time a mendicant is meditating by observing an aspect of principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: So yaṃ taṃ hoti abhijjhādomanassānaṃ pahānaṃ taṃ paññāya disvā sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā hoti.
segments.en: Having seen with wisdom the giving up of desire and aversion, they watch closely over with equanimity.

segments.pli: Tasmātihānanda, dhammesu dhammānupassī bhikkhu tasmiṃ samaye viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ. (4)
segments.en: Therefore, at such a time a mendicant is meditating by observing an aspect of principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, catumahāpathe mahāpaṃsupuñjo.
segments.en: Suppose there was a large heap of sand at the crossroads.

segments.pli: Puratthimāya cepi disāyaṃ āgaccheyya sakaṭaṃ vā ratho vā, upahanateva taṃ paṃsupuñjaṃ;
segments.en: And a cart or chariot were to come by from the east,

segments.pli: pacchimāya cepi disāya āgaccheyya …
segments.en: west,

segments.pli: uttarāya cepi disāya …
segments.en: north,

segments.pli: dakkhiṇāya cepi disāya āgaccheyya sakaṭaṃ vā ratho vā, upahanateva taṃ paṃsupuñjaṃ.
segments.en: or south and destroy that heap of sand.

segments.pli: Evameva kho, ānanda, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharantopi upahanateva pāpake akusale dhamme;
segments.en: In the same way, when a mendicant is meditating by observing an aspect of the body,

segments.pli: vedanāsu … pe …
segments.en: feelings,

segments.pli: citte … pe …
segments.en: mind,

segments.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharantopi upahanateva pāpake akusale dhamme”ti.
segments.en: or principles, they destroy bad, unskillful qualities.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Ekadhammavaggo paṭhamo.
Ekadhammo ca bojjhaṅgo,
suddhikañca duve phalā;
Ariṭṭho kappino dīpo,
vesālī kimilena cāti.

suttaplex.blurb: When the Buddha asks Venerable Kimbila about breath meditation, he is unable to answer. At Ānanda’s urging, the Buddha explains in detail.
